Reviews.Title: “Best service of all time and I know of what I speak!!”
Reviews.Author: pjktd
Reviews.Content: I've been in the meeting/incentive industry for over 20 years and some years, can spend over 200 nights in hotels, all over the world. But the best service I've ever received, ever, was the little Westin Park Central in Dallas. This was in the early 00's but I've never forgotten the amazing staff at that hotel, especially in the Banquet Department. Those men and women under the leadership of the best of the best, Mike Tej, surpassed every banquet department I've ever worked with, before and since. Extremely attentive to every detail, personal attention to myself and my staff, but best of all, the same amazing attention to my attendees. Which, to me, is the most important of all. A little hotel in the middle of what I call The Corporate Jungle of Dallas, it's probably overlooked by anyone other than business travellers and the meeting industry, and that's a shame. I love that hotel and that banquet staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-thugs broke in my car.”
Reviews.Author: vacationfamily3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The room was excellent, we had a jr. suite. The work out facilty and pool were great too. We stayed 3 nights. The last night six cars were vandalized and broken into, our car being one of them. The security guard was nice and provided us with a trash bag and tape for our window that was missing. The police officer commented on the break in with "this is Dallas for you."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Round - Great room”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for one night during a two week business trip to the USA. From the moment we arrived the service was excellent. We were given a room on a SPG floor. The room was spacious and airy with all the amenities that you would expect from a Westin hotel. We asked the belldesk for directions to the local shopping mall - instead of simply giving us the directions they offered to make a special trip in the courtesy shuttle, which we gladly accepted. The westin workout facility was excellent, and we enjoyed fabulous latte from the coffee shop before leaving for the airport. An excellent hotel - we really enjoyed our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but far from all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: Gareth G
Reviews.Content: We got a reasonable rate via Expedia. The hotel and room were first rate; however, parking was an additional $12.99; internet service was an additional $9 and use of the fitness center was $15. Although the hotel offers a business center as an included amenity, it is closed during the weekend. Had the business center been open, there was a charge to use wifi/internet.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good food”
Reviews.Author: RICamper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Park Central in Dallas for a 3 day conference in March 2012. The hotel lobby is updated and inviting with many guest socializing. I had a room on the 7th floor. When I entered the room I was hit with the smell of paint. It was obvious someone had just painted in the room and was unsure if I could handle sleeping with the strong odor. I also noticed paint dust on the shower fixtures in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and I did sleep well. I was told the rooms that were booked for the conference included WiFi but it was not offered to me. There was no indoor pool and the outdoor pool was drained. If I had my daughter with me she would have been very disappointed. The hotel provided the food for the conference which was very good and plentiful. The hotel is located in an areas consisting of mostly office buildings and you cannot walk to a store unless you cross a 8 line busy street. I thought the hotel did a great job hosting the conference but the rooms and the amenities are average at best.

Reviews.Title: “worse than a roadside motel”
Reviews.Author: nalla5Texas
Reviews.Content: Wow. You walk in the lobby and its stunning. There is new/modern decor, eye catching restaurants and bar but then you get the key to your room! The room was worse than a roadside motel. It smelled of mildew. The bedding was old and pilled. The pillows were flat and yellowed. I had to put a pair of socks on because the carpet was so dingy. The curtains needed to be steamed. Basically it had been years since this room had been updated. The bathroom was worse. The tile was all broken and the faucet was coming out of the tub. There was mildew in the tile. It was nasty. we decided to get out of the room and try the advertised heated pool but the pool had been drained and so had the hot tub/whirlpool with a big sign: CLOSED

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor and rude customer service”
Reviews.Author: Adnaan J
Reviews.Content: First of all the pool wasn't working and they act as if that's okay. Not for the price you pay!!! The customer service is horrible. They have a shuttle service that take you within 5 miles of the hotel. So we wanted to go to the mall which is within range so when I call to ask they told me that they can't take me to the mall because the mall service runs every 3 hours and the next one is in 2 hours. So I asked the guy "You take guests within 5 miles of the hotel right?" and he answered "Yes but just not the mall." So I tell him if I find something close to the mall will you take me there "He was like yes" so I said "Can you just take me to the mall then?" and he was like sorry "We can't do that, mall shuttles run every 3 hours." ARE YOU SERIOUS???? So I ended up looking up a restaurant half a mile away from the mall and going down to the shuttle desk. The guy I had just spoken to was there. I ask them to take the to the restaurant. He asked me if it was near the mall, I said yes, but you won't take me to the mall so... Then he started being dumb was like well if you have asked me for a favor, I would have said yes. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? You are a 4 star hotel!!! You should have been taught customer service and offered me a ride there when I asked over the phone. Never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cmtx36
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived at hotel all I experienced was friendly service. The valet was very helpful and friendly. The front desk staff was very welcoming and informative. Checkin was smooth and quick. My room was clean and very updated. From the minute I sat on the bed I didn't want to get up because it was so comfortable. I attended a brunch at the hotel and the food was very good. Food was hot and tasty. Hotel is in a great location right by freeway and a huge mall.

Reviews.Title: “Room a little dirty but ok stay”
Reviews.Author: texlawdog
Reviews.Content: We ha some stains on one of the beds that were obvious and in plain view. Other than that, nice place, good location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, horrible plumbing”
Reviews.Author: MCH65
Reviews.Content: I was part of a large group staying at the Westin Central Park Hotel this past week. The staff was very friendly but the hotel is older, and shows some signs of it's age. The first morning of our stay, there was no hot water for anyone trying to shower at 6:30 am. When we inquired at the front desk, they said they were aware of it and the issue was affecting floors 11 through 17. That's a lot of people without hot water for a shower! The following day, there was hot water, but no water pressure. I couldn't get even a trickle of water out of the shower head. There was a little bit of water that came out of the tub spout, but with it came about a 1/4 cup of dirty sandy-like grit. Letting the water run, it took 45 minutes to fill the tub 6 inches. Some other people in our group had water, but it was a murky brown. Not sure what the issue was, but this was not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not the Westin Standard”
Reviews.Author: rlfraz
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because the Hilton Central Park where our conference is full and because of my loyalty to the Starwood brand. This hotel is nice, but is not the Westin standard. I am currently staying here as I write... When we pulled up to the hotel we nonchalantly greeted by the valet parking attendants who were not eager to lets us park at the entrance so we could check in and learn about our parking options. So we decided to self-park in the parking garage which is $12.00 a day and needs makeover. When we went to check-in at the Platinum Spg desk which I am a member we were informed that because a travel agent had booked the trip through a third party vendor none of the Platinum benefits applied even though the price paid come to find out was more than what the hotel charged on its website. I can understand this, but the customer service by the Spg desk some of the worst I have seen and for a Westin I expected better as I have received better service from a four pointâ€™s Spg hotel. Also, internet is 9.99 a day as well which is free at most hotels these days. Once in the room it is extremely outdated and the linens on one bed needed to be changed because they were stained, and the AC did not work so it had to be fixed. The hotel was full with a conference so it took longer than normal to fix these issues which I understand and the desk did check to see if they were completed. It just was a sad standard for this hotel to represent the Westin Brand. Also, the walls are very thin so you are able to hear the room next to you FYI Overall, the lobby makeover is nice and the rooms are spacious and it is a good location for business in north Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at the lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: JohnEH H
Reviews.Content: We tried the fish and chips oil actually ran out of the food, tried the calamari - tasteless, tried the crab cakes thought they were supposed to have crab in them. Tried the burger not good However breakfast is Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, awful parking garage.”
Reviews.Author: Rebekahj0
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with hotwire.com and it turned out to be very nice! Now, some of the reviews say that there is free parking and some contradict that. We found the complimentary parking lot across the street from Benihana, so it's a bit of a walk, but it is there. We used the parking garage which we thought was a little scary, even though the hotel is very nice. I don't know that I would stay there again or recommend it to a friend, though.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cozy”
Reviews.Author: Csamgo
Reviews.Content: Friendly service. They upgraded our room at no cost. The bed was very comfortable. We got a discounted price through another site so it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: ERock09
Reviews.Content: we had a great time here for a birthday getaway, took full use of the shuttle to get to the galleria. Check in desk was friendly, room was excellent, room service was good although we just had dessert. great property, and the restaurant across the street was excellent. only downfall was the crazy price to park! other than that i would recommend staying here for anyone looking to be close to the galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hhrvt
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for this hotel on hotwire, ad was pleased when I saw the location, easy to get to, and easy to go anywhere in north Dallas. The lobby looks great, check in was super fast on a Sat around noon. We did the free parking on the corner, but valet and self-park for a fee is available as well. The room needs cosmetic updating, but was in good shape. The bed was super soft. Which some people (frex my husband) may like, but it wrecked my back after only one night. There is no exhaust in the bathroom, so by the time we had both showered, the condensation on the windows was so bad, there were puddles on the window sill. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are about a million other places to eat in a 10 minute radius. Also about 5 minutes from The Galleria Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: LoraKB
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and got an excellent rate. We were in Dallas for a conference, downtown at the convention center and drove in each day. The staff were all friendly. Check-in was a breeze. I asked if we could have a refrigerator in our room because my colleague needed to refrigerate her insulin. The clerk said no problem and placed us in a room with a refrigerator. The beds were comfortable, and the room had a desk to work in and a large easy chair. Perhaps it was because we were there on a weekend, but the place never seemed to be very busy, with only the lobby bar open during the evenings. The location was nice, a quiet business area, with corporate offices near by. While they offered vallet parking and a parking garage (for a fee), we parked free in a lot diagonally across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Only if You Need Accomodations in the Area and Book Cheap with Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: RobertGrunnah
Reviews.Content: Because I book many hotels on Hotwire for the great prices, this review is based on the low price I paid. Had I paid the hotel's "rack rate" on their website, the review would have been 2 stars. But for $58/nt, it's pretty much the best deal you can find in decently Central/North Dallas for clean accommodations. Frankly, I think Starwood makes a mistake in branding these old, outdated hotels Westins. I remember not too long ago when a Westin meant something special and contemporary; now it seems to be their stodgiest brand, based on several recent stays in different cities. The rooms' decor was rather shockingly 1980's. The curtains, with their dark red floral patterns, were laughable, as was the outdated sink, shower, and bathroom. The windows looking out were filthy; apparently window washing when out the door at some point in the 90's. All of that said, the Starbucks in the room was nice, the staff was friendly, the common areas and parking clean. Didn't use the gym this time, and it's annoying to have to pay $12 for parking in such a parking lot of a city, and $10 for slow internet access is still a rub. But you can tell that they're just trying to get whatever extra fees they can, since they have to offer such low nightly room rates. All in all, it beats the Super 8 or Travelodge experience, but not by much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra J
Reviews.Content: The place seems to be nice & updated especially lobby is wonderful. No problems at all during the stay except the shower which didn't had much pressure as expected according to the luxury hotel. Will stay again if visiting dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LyndaD3
Reviews.Content: I booked a couple of rooms for myself and family to attend the Armed Forces Bowl. This hotel is beautiful. Parking was easy and it was a great location for anything in central Dallas. It was also in a beautiful and quiet area, while only 2 minutes to several freeways. The bathroom was very luxurious. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Still looking for 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Lynn1962LA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good service, clean, safe area, adequate decor,Starbucks coffee in room. Cons: small room, small double beds, no refridgerator or micowave in the room but there were spaces for them, no free wi-fi, but you could pay $5.95 for 15 minutes of internet service in their business services office, the surprise of a $13 per night parking fee, no complimentary breakfast as found in most 2 star hotels but you can avail yourself of their $18.50 breakfast buffet or go light for the $8.50 bowl of oatmeal. This hotel was nothing special and in fact lacked some of the basic amentities found in most lower ranked hotels such as a microwave, fridge, free wifi, parking and breakfast. I was not impressed and am still looking for the basis for their 4 star ranking....

Reviews.Title: “Westin Park Central in Dallas.. Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: asgross1
Reviews.Content: I came here for a convention and stayed at the hotel. Everything was fabulous--from the check-in, the room and room service. Very reasonable rates and the hotel is just minutes away from the Dallas Galleria! The only thing that would have made it better was to have free wi-fi in the hotel room--don't most places offer this these days?

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Thefoox
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby bar Rooms need to be refurbished Well located

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing specials”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, updated and comfortable. We have no complaints, but it was nothing special. Although we had a fantastic rate through Hotwire, when we added the cost of parking, we may have been better off staying at a hotel that was just as nice and included breatkfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and solid property”
Reviews.Author: jonnytri
Reviews.Content: Solid property.... kind of a ghost town on this particular weekend. Beds great and lots of room. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Westin for a Low Price”
Reviews.Author: Larry8241
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price. Most Westins are much more expensive. This one was well under $100. Great location near the malls and rooms are nice and well kept. Shower pressure is very low though. Found that in other reviews in here as well. Other than that, not a bad place to stay. Steer clear of the simple and not-to-much buffet breakfast though. $20 per person is ridiculous. McDonalds is right across the street and the same crummy calorie intake can be had for $2.99

Reviews.Title: “Just an average Westin”
Reviews.Author: HHWEEB
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write a review. I stay at Sheraton so often and only seldom get a chance to move up the brand. This Hotel is fine, don't get me wrong. But it's amazing how Westins in general don't do nearly as much for preferred guests. The average is higher but the delux club level isn't much better than the general room. This hotels lounge was free of amenities beyond chairs. Come on Westin shape up and be upscale. How is it that I would rather stay at Sheraton than get average treatment for more money with you.

Reviews.Title: “Low shower pressure convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sfrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip. The staff was very helpful and room service was great. Heavenly beds were comfortable but my room was a bit dated and the shower pressure was not heavenly. Wifi signal to my room was weak which made it difficult to do work.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Westin but still ok”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Westin hotels in Dubai, Macau, Shanghai and Florida the Westin Park Central didn't quite seem up to standard. My room on the Club floor was ok but not special in any way and the restaurant was basic. To my surprise they tried to charge $9.99/night for Internet access even though this is not indicated on the website or booking details. Staff were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: jj114558277
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin on business last month and the hotel was very nice. Great location if this is where you need to be and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The shuttle drivers took us to a great mexican restaurant nearby and I enjoyed the lobby bar very much. Rooms were very comfortable and although they charge some fees for parking and internet I dont find this so shocking since many hotels still charge for these things, esp business hotels. I would recommend to anyone needing a hotel in this area!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not much cleaner as expected .”
Reviews.Author: SUPER8_2008
Reviews.Content: The rooms weren't cleaner as expected. The main thing you need to check whether the room is clean or not move the nightstand & you will see how much dust n other trash is there behind the nightstand. The water pressure was not as expected inspite of 2 fancy big showerheads in the bathroom. I was there on conference the chips they served in the lunch were expired 1 month earlier I show the pack to the server with the date on it & he said they were the only they had. Its shame for a hotel like this to serve expired food to their guests I wonder if they do the same thing with the rest of the food give spoiled food to the guests staying ..

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & dime their customers”
Reviews.Author: Runnin26
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is nice enough, staff friendly, but food is overpriced & just ok. Parking charge when every other hotel that practically borders the property has free parking. Internet charge...but the worst charge came when I went to get a soda out the refreshment center that my hotel provided book says every room has in the armoir. No refreshment center...so I called front desk & they knew...asked about vending machine but Westin hotel doesn't have vending machines. Long story short, no other choice, I had to order room service. A can of sprite cost me 4.42.

Reviews.Title: “Even when you're not paying full price...”
Reviews.Author: LadySundance
Reviews.Content: I stay at The Westin Park Central numerous times throughout the year and have always been impressed with the accomodations but also their service. I wanted to write a review this time as I had booked thru Hotwire and this was the hotel I was booked into. Truly I figured I'd get a "so so" greeting at the desk and a room in the north forty but low and behold it made no difference to the front desk people (as it shouldn't). I was treated just as if I was paying full price, my room was on the 14th floor and only about 6 doors from the elevator. Thank you Westin corporate for making sure ALL guests are treated properly. One thought, please consider allowing Hotwire guests be allowed to at least halve half Starwood points applied.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: bb833cs
Reviews.Content: Room was adequate, nothing special. The bed was very comfortable and the dual shower heads were nice, but both can be found in any Westin hotel. I thought the location was great, right at LBJ Freeway and 75, but I agree with most reviews that there really isn't anything to do immediately around the hotel. Parking options are ridiculous in my opinion.... $22/day for Valet... $14/day for Garage self park and the free parking lot was a 4-5 minute walk and had the smallest, most difficult to maneuver parking spots I've ever seen. It would be one thing if the hotel was in a downtown or city center, but this place is like a ghost town during nights and weekends. And don't ask to leave your car in the front of the hotel for 5 minutes while you run up to your room to grab something, the valet will tell you to park it in the adjacent office building's parking lot but "don't let the security guard see you." So plan on making the walk every time you come or go if you don't want to pay $14/day + for parking. Overall, it was ok, but no nicer than a Hampton Inn or Courtyard. Next time, I wouldn't stay here, unless the place was renovated and the parking options were cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: peteytee05
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate hotel, very comfy beds and clean. Not a great area of town, it was safe and all, just not a lot going on around it. Perfectly fine, just nothing special and would stay somewhere else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ceg5277
Reviews.Content: If you haven't stayed in a Westin Heavenly Bed, get ready. It'll be hard to stay anywhere else after that!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alinum
Reviews.Content: The positives: the hotel itself is decent, with clean comfortable rooms, and a nice pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The negatives: location is not ideal, as there does not seem to be much to do in the area. In that respect, it may be best suited for business travellers. Also, the food is terrible! If you can help it, don't bother eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Geeze”
Reviews.Author: DScardino
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel itself was a nice place for the weekend. We were there for an expo that was being hosted there. The rooms on the other hand were in questionable shape though when we arrived. The first room was actually open before we got to it. Which is strange because the doors all have a spring mechanism that keeps them from staying open. That creeped my fiancee out so we asked for another room. The 2nd room had a dirty bathroom door. Grimey handprints all over the edge, probably from the workers who'd been repairing the bathroom. I knew there was work going on it it because a lot of the shower tile was partially de-caulked and not yet recaulked, and whomever was doing the job just used putty to plug some old screw holes where the shower curtain rod used to be attached. So that was the bathroom. The phone by the bed was dead. The safe didn't work. We had to call and ask for a refrigerator which was supposed to already be included in the room. The AC in the room comes primarily from a 14x14 vent on one side of the room, and the flow can't be guided to where the bed is. The other vent was about 5x7 and located way by the door. The last but worst thing, one of the sheets had old blood stains on the top hem area where you grab it to cover yourself. I guess at least it wasn't fresh, right? So we obviously called the front desk about the problems, in our "lemon/salvage room", and they did fix the phone, and bring a refrigerator, and fix the safe. ...We hadn't yet seen the blood on the sheet. The whole odd experience made it feel like they decided, "Ok, no one go fix anything that needs attention. Lets just wait to see what the guests say and then worry about it." The other staff does deserve recognition though. They were all very responsive and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 573Lisa_S_11573
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. They nickel and dime you for every little thing; NOTHING is included. The food is bland and expensive; a bowl of oatmeal and juice was $17!! The rooms are nothing special, no view, walls are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't up to Westin standards. Rooms/Lobby are tired, the executive lounge wasn't even open during a wed/thur stay. Rooms have that late 90's feel, A/C wasn't working which was fixed promptly. Parking options are laid out to extract the most money out of guest! option 1 valet $$$, option 2 hotel parking garage $$, option 3 ( this is the one you need to ask about) is free parking is lot across street. The location is great if your meeting in adjacent office park otherwise i would suggest area's near the galleria/addisson or the park cities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for conference”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference and found the hotel clean and a good value and well set up for meetings

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: littleone3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July. Check in was very smooth and since we were starwood memebers they upgraded us to a corner room which was very nice sized. The room was very clean. We also had vouchers for free breakfast and the buffet was excellent. The other plus side to the hotel is they accept pets without charging fees. The main downside to the hotel is the parking. If you don't want to valet or pay $12 a day you can park in the complimentary lot by Benihana. We have parked there when we stayed at the hotel previously so we parked there both nights. It is somewhat of a pain because it is a decent walk to the car and the Dallas heat doesn't make it much fun. I do think the hotel could greatly improve the security of this lot though. Our truck along with several other vehicles got broken into the 2nd night we stayed there. I knew that this was our responsibility, but it would have been nice for the staff to have at least acted concearned or like they cared when I told them what happened. The guy just shrugged his shoulders and told me they didn't assume any liability. When the police came they told me there have been a lot of break ins in the area so I would recommend that if they hotel is going to offer free parking that they should either have cameras in the lot or have some sort of security. Overall this is a good hotel, but if you are going to stay there I would pay to park in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & quiet. Great for business.”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms. Bathrooms looking a little tired.the junior suites are very spacious though the couch looked like it was stained with something (i prefer not to think what). Parking is $12 a night and you can use your room key to get in and out of the garage which is attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still pretty nice place . . . room was nice, etc.”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Well, I had the opportunity to stay in the area again, so checked my previous reviews, and this one had a good review. Last time I was upgraded to a large suite, this time I was not. Well, that is fine, I guess. But I am certain there were suites available for upgrades, and there were very few people here this week. So, if you are Platinum, I guess it does not mean you always get an upgrade. Anyhow, the room was pretty nice. There was an actual stocked mini fridge there. Seems that most Westins have emptied them out. There was a problem with my room, there were occasional loud vibrations coming from somewhere. It did not interfere with sleep so I did not ask for a new room. Nothing more annoying than having to move after you have unpacked everything! I figured out the noise was the elevator, as my room was near it, and I was on the 19th floor...so probably near the motors or something. The room service was wonderful, expensive, but wonderful. They need a larger menu though...my only recommendation from that perspective. Front desk staff was very pleasant. I was checking out, and needed to get an updated receipt. When I went to the desk, there was a long line...and they saw me standing there at the back of the line, and the clerk asked me if I needed something. He took care of me right away. Unbelievable. I am not special, but that sure made my day! :) Did not get a chance to do the gym or pool. But did eat at Harey Carey's one night! Yum! Also, I was there when it was very hot, and the air conditioning worked very well. Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Just O.k. but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: hampr
Reviews.Content: The Lobby was beautiful but the rooms had somewhat of a stale smell to them. Room Service and the breakfast menu was definitely a little pricey. Not my ideal of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the price it was ok.”
Reviews.Author: Would_Rather_Be_Home
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few Westin hotels in my time, and this one was a little less modern than the others I have stayed in. The lobby and restaurant were great and so was the service. No complaints there. The room was a little dated. Bathroom was older, but not bad. My room overlooked the roof with old tennis courts with ac units sitting on top of them. I would stay there again, but not at the price of a newer Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: dkelsey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, very friendly staff. The rooms are nice but not as updated as the lobby. We arrived late because of a delayed flight and I was a little leery about ordering room service so late and possibly getting blah food. The food was great! The server was so nice - I wish I could remember his name. Check in/out was easy. Every employee I encountered was incredibly nice. I was disappointed in the pool. It was very shallow and surrounded by a metal rail. It was a 107 degrees. If you try to hold onto the side of the pool you will get burned. Parking was $12 a day and they charge for internet (who does that anymore?!) Overall I thought the hotel was nice. Very clean, nice location, excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LaVsLeagueCity_Texas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Lots of unjustified, naysaying reviews out there. This is a really nice, clean, well appointed comfortable hotel. While they may not have updated during the last month, whenever they did, they invested in quality, and take good care of it. I found the employees to be caring, and very service oriented. My husband and I agreed, our room was worth much more than we paid for it. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyof4SoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only as a stop on a family trip. The hotel is nice and clean, rooms are a bit small. We arrived late at night and unfortunately there was not anywhere in the hotel to even get a snack or bottle of water. It is a conveniently located hotel right off of the highway and is good for business, but there is not free wi-fi. I would rate this hotel a 3 1/2 star, not 4. We got a great price on the room through priceline, otherwise I would have been a bit disappointed paying the advertised rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great lobby...rooms a bit tired though...”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 1 night at this hotel. We just came from Puerto Vallarta, Mexico where we were for 3 weeks and heading to Colorado and didn't want to do it all in one day so we overnighted. We booked 2 connecting rooms as we have two small kids and needed to be next to them. I stayed here before many many years ago and I remember it being nicer. The rooms feel a bit tired compared to the really great lobby and bar area downstairs. I agree with a previous poster that said those areas are nice compared to the rooms. Still, the rooms aren't bad and very comfortable. The beds are very comfortable just like all the Westin hotels we've stayed in. Our rooms were quiet as well. We valet parked for the $20/night and the valet guys are VERY friendly and always super quick. We always tipped them every time we left and they were always good about helping with bags. We wanted to be in this area as it's not far from both the Galleria Mall and Northpark. We did a ton of shopping so it was convenient. The one big negative I'd say is on the adjoining rooms the system is really bad. On every hotel we've stayed at, there is a lock to lock the door to connect the rooms but the rooms don't automatically lock when the door is closed. But here it does which is dangerous if you have toddlers. We had a problem with this as our 19 month son and our 3 year old daughter were playing in one of the suites. We were in the other suite. The door was open between the rooms. We had the security lock on the inside of the main door. Well the door closed between the rooms and the door automatically locked. Our 19 month old son got trapped in the other room. I immediately called down and they came up immediately from maintenance which we really appreciated. The manager also came up and was great. The problem was that the tool they had to open the security latch was broken and it took some time for them to open the door. I can't blame them as they were really trying hard. Our son was scared and crying the entire time and the manager was so great even offering to break the door down. The maintenance guy got it unlocked after a bit. The only thing I'd recommend for the hotel is (a) got that tool fixed in case this happens again; (b) fix the adjoining room locks so the doors don't automatically lock when the door is closed. All the hotels we've been in have a lock that you can manually lock. Or at the very least if they see parents booking two rooms with kids, warn them about the door and that it will lock automatically. But I was really happy with how quickly the manager acted and how he was willing to break down the door if the maintenance guy couldn't get it. That was great. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel downstairs. Rooms ok.”
Reviews.Author: roamingraider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin this past June. When you enter the hotel it is very appealling. The lobby, bar and restaurant are all very nice. The staff was very friendly. When we got to the room I was a little disappointed. It wasn't bad just was nothing special compared to downstairs. It felt old and in need of remodelling. It was very clean and quite large, but I just could never get over the plainness of everything. Self park was reasonable at $12 but they also charged for internet which while I know it is common it drives me insane. Overall it was above average but nothing spectacular. If you can get a reasonable price on a discounted site it is worth it but I wouldn't pay full price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but too pricey on the extras”
Reviews.Author: MsWoody0764
Reviews.Content: I attended the Talent & Modeling EXPO in June 2011. The hotel was clean & very comfortable. My family and I was there for five days, with self parking at $12/day, in-room internet service at $10/day, no breakfast included ($18/day breakfest buffet in hotel resturant), this could have become a very expensive trip. We chose to improvise. We parked in the complimentary lot accross the street. We used the free internet in the hotel lobby, this is very inconvenience. I got up early and went to McDonalds to get breakfast. Also the in-room $3 bottle water we did not touch. The most dissapointing thing was we got to the room and there is no refrigerator or microwave as advertised. I went to the front desk about this and they did bring me a microwave, but they put me on a waiting list for a refrigerator and I never received it. I went Walmart and brought a cooler. The hotel pool and weight room was nice. I was hoping for a indoor spa, but none. Overall we had a very good trip and we enjoyed the stay. Will we stay here again, yes for this event, but no for a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Gelf89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in early June and found it to be average. The staff were polite and friendly and the entry gave the impression one was entering an above average Westin. However, this is where the renovations ended. The room was very dated, from the curtains, wallpaper, and A/C in the room to the shower fixtures. The room had a musty smell and the A/C needed to be cranked way down to get the room to a comfortable temperature. The hotel is not located next to any restaurants (I did notice a Japanese steakhouse down the street as I was leaving the next day), so I had lunch at the on-site restaurant. Over priced and low quality. I had to stay here for business, but if given the option, I don't think I'd return for the price I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hsessel
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th stay this year. Not a new property but priced accordingly and the staff have gone out of their way to be accommodating. In response to some of the critics: 1) The breakfast is priced the same as comparable Marriotts and the quality is good 2) The hotel is clean..... 3) On the comment it should be a Sheraton:What doctor do you use?

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: Pieman99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Park Central on the night of June 1, 2011. Their in-house television advertisement projected that in-room movies start at $5. They did not give a range for how high the cost could be. I ordered an old classic to watch. They charged me $16 for it. I went to their business center to use the internet. The cost of 15 minutes of internet was an exhorbitant $6. Even motels offer free internet. A small bottle of common mineral water in the room was labelled at $3. The hotel is located in a complex of buildings. The easier access to parking was closed, to find an alternate required several rounds around the complex. The charge for one night of parking was $12. It seems that this hotel's mission is to skin the guest for whatever they can.

Reviews.Title: “An average place with some negatives”
Reviews.Author: BearSantaFe
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot (50-75 nights a year) and this hotel, like others I've stayed at, gives you a nice bed and a clean, well-appointed room. What distinguishes this hotel? Poor management and inattention to its operations. I rarely dine in hotel restaurants as they typically are over-priced and serve mediocre meals. I had breakfast here because I needed to get fed and on with the business that brought me to Dallas for the week. So, 18 bucks for the breakfast buffet struck me as steep, but it was still a deal compared to ordering off the menu. Then, there's the in-room safe: it didn't work so I reported it to the reception desk folks and was told they'd send up somebody to fix it. Nothing happened for two days and then I gat a phone message saying I had to be in the room while the technician made the repair. I called and said I was busy during the day and could not meet the technician in my room and, as an upshot, the safe never was repaired. The green initiative (keep your towels and don't have the sheets changed every day) seemed not to have been communicated to housekeeping, as in spite of leaving the little message placard out for the housekeepers, I received freshly laundered towels and sheets every day. And then there's the thing that's a big dissatisfier for me: guests have to pay for internet access in their rooms -- geez, how chintzy can a hotel be? Plus, one pays for printing in the business center. At Holiday Inn, by comparison, this stuff comes with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Romina1234
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is great. The room was clean and big. The location was good, but the hotel has the pool closed for renovations. I liked the service the best and the closed pool the least.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: aanettles
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel with Hotwire and was pleased with the price, $ 81.00 for a 4-star hotel. Checked in went smooth but what I didn't know that I was going to be charged $12.99 for overnight parking. Not happy but what can you do? The room was nice and was spacious. It would have been nice to have queen double instead of a full double. The beds were awesome though. No free wi-fi or wired. Another $13.00 a day and they even have a data plan if you want to go that way. That's just greed in my opinion. You can get free wi-fi and parking at a Super8 but they will tell you that it is the atmosphere and such but when it comes down to it all hotels are the same when your eyes are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: JJ67Albuquerque
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week. Not anything like every other Westin I have stayed at - except the bed. There were dead cockroaches on the floors of hallways for multiple days (not cleaned up). The breakfast buffet was outrageousely priced! Seriously!? $20 for yogurt, fruit, eggs that don't taste like eggs and bacon that is low quality. Customer service left a lot to be desired. I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - so so location”
Reviews.Author: MMBarnes
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It is clean and kept up well. The lobby has been updated not so much the rooms but they are in good shape. The valet was good and may be needed since parking is not very close. It is expensive but options are limited. This hotel has a nice lobby with an expensive restaurant and a small bar area if you are interested. The rooms are nice and bathroom is in good shape. This feels like a business hotel and is near the highway. There is a japanese restaurant nearby but not alot of other restaurants or any shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Only book if you get a good deal - don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: lizalot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights weekend of 2/25/11. The lobby decor was what you'd expect for a hotel of this size/class. Front desk, valet & room service staff were all exceedingly professional & courteous. Room service food was mediocre - need more healthy items. They have things that are labeled as healthy, but they really aren't due to sugar content or other additions. Perhaps they will make more healthful options upon request, not sure as I didn't ask. Regular guest rooms were average. All items were in working order, but wallpaper was beginning to peel in bathroom. Linens & pillows were great (tons of extra pillows), but the mattresses gave both husband and I backaches. They feel comfortable when you sit on them, but upon waking, both of our back hurt. Couldn't ask for a better location - right next to two major highways that will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go in the area. Lobby bar wasn't open at 2:30 in the afternoon on a Saturday, which surprised me. Front desk staff directed me to the hotel's in-house pub instead, which also wasn't open. Room service came to the rescue. There were two conferences going on (one H.S. cheerleaders) and I did not find noise to be an issue. Lobby was somewhat crowded with shabbily dressed conference-goers, though. Had to pay $10/day for internet connection in the room. Pay-per-view movie (great selection) was $12.00. Didn't check out the pool due to time of year. Overall, I would never pay full price for this hotel, but if you get a deal ($90 or less), it's worth it. I rated it highly for value because I got a great deal through hotwire.com, rating does not apply to the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: bjones0706
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 40 straight day and experienced nothing but exceptional service!!! The staff was always very friendly, courteous, and helpful (especially Chalang, Nicole, and Sara). they made this stay one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: rickdhughes
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m writing to let you know that out of all my travels I have never walked into a hotel that was staffed by such professionals that were full of pride of their hotel. This past week with very bad weather here in North Texas and the Super Bowl, your staff met every challenge with a smile and a can do attitude. I would like to give thanks to the cleaning staff, the front desk staff and the valets that stood many hours out in the cold. I was met by Nicole each morning with a warm greeting and a very proud smile. You have a great hotel; I look to book all my stays with the Westin. Great Job

Reviews.Title: “20 Years ago this might have been a great place”
Reviews.Author: otrx
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for one night after arriving from a longhaul flight. The hotel is underwhelming if you are expecting a Westin standard. While the lobby looks nice, the rooms are outdated and need a renovation. The design and decor look like they have been around for 20 years. Items that are used a lot (like the lamps) show wear. Turning on/off lights requires you to look around areas that you'd rather avoid due to dust and dirt accumulating (e.g. when turning on/off the bedside lamp it is not possible to avoid looking behind the bed). There was water leaking under the toilet, and stains showed it was not the first time it happened. All in all a very plain experience, if they would slap a Sheraton (or even Holiday Inn) logo on the door it wouldn't seem out of place, apart from the lobby. The good parts: There is free parking across the street and also free WiFi in the lobby. They did reply almost immediately to 2 emails I sent them beforehand. We had booked this hotel through Hotwire at a ~60 USD rate. For that price it is good, but again, nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Christmas Eve”
Reviews.Author: RuthAStoddard
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the hotel on Christmas Eve, Sitha was a wonderful person to have at the front desk. She immediately made us feel comfortable, welcome and special. That set the tone for our time there. It was such an enjoyable experience that we may do this every year! Thanks for great service, a great room and gracious employees!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel TURNS DOWN revenue and Dirty Linen in room?”
Reviews.Author: rcandelaria519
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll start by stating that I have Gold Status with SPG and that while I have only been at the hotel less than 3 hours, they have already managed to not meet my standards of what a Westin property is. My partner and I were looking for a hotel in the Dallas so we could visit for a few days to celebrate our Anniversary. The property had a special rate at the SPG site online for a non-refundable rate for a traditional room, so we decided to book it. After booking the reservation online I called the SPG Gold Customer Service number to see if I could PAY to upgrade to a Deluxe Suite since they were not available online. I was notified by SPG Gold Customer Service that I would need to contact the property directly to arrange for an upgrade. I called the hotel the morning of our arrival, TODAY, to see if they had any deluxe suites I could PAY to upgrade to and was told that they would give me a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suite based on my Gold status. I informed the gentleman I spoke with that while I appreciated that offer, I was really wanting to PAY for an upgrade to a Deluxe Suite since we were on the way to Dallas to celebrate our Anniversary and was told that Iâ€™d have to call a different number at the hotel to do that and was given the phone number [---]. I called that number and got a voicemail that she was out of the office until Monday, January 3rd. I called the hotel again and was given the same gentleman at the front desk and was told, once again, that they could give me a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suite. I donâ€™t mean to sound ungrateful for what they offered based on my Gold Status, but it is still not what I wanted and what I WAS WILLING TO PAY FOR!!!!! What hotel turns down money from someone willing to pay for upgrades that werenâ€™t available online??? I finally arrived at the hotel around 4pm and was notified by the front desk agent, a very kind and welcoming young lady, that I had been upgraded to â€œa suiteâ€� based on my gold status and thanked me for staying with them. Once checked-in to the hotel I went to my room and went to take a nap before we went out for the night. As we were about to nap, we noticed that the pillow cases had stains and when we pulled back the sheets there was even a tag from a piece of clothing that someone had purchased at a store for a womanâ€™s size 18. I went to the front desk to notify they young lady about it and she apologized and quickly sent someone from Housekeeping up to the room. When the lady from housekeeping arrived she looked at the sheets and changed the pillowcases and told me that the stains are normal and they happen from being washed. She also seemed to see nothing wrong with the clothing tag that was found in the bed and said that â€œit must have fallen out of a pocket when the housekeeper was cleaning.â€� So in the past 2 hours this hotel has managed to make it where we couldnâ€™t get the room we wanted, couldnâ€™t take a nap on a bed with CLEAN linens, and we had to explain why finding a tag for womenâ€™s clothing in our bed was not acceptable. I would NOT recommend this Westin property to any guests. All I can say is Iâ€™m thankful that we donâ€™t have dinner reservations at the hotel because aside from the young lady at the front desk, this hotel needs some major help. Next year weâ€™ll find another Starwood Property in the Dallas area that can live up the standards of an SPG property, allow us to PAY for the Upgrade or room we want, and have clean linens on the beds. The part that frustrates me the most about this, besides them ruining our anniversary, is that aside the from young lady at the front desk when I checked inâ€¦ this all seems to be acceptable to them and no one has offered to correct anything or even offer to find a way to get us the room we really wanted. All we gotâ€¦ some clean linens, which should have been clean when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Persoanlized customer service”
Reviews.Author: clchand
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for frequent travelers. The staff goes out of their way to say hello and proactively ask if I need anything - particularly Yonis at the front desk. The hotel has a superior fitness facility with up-to-date elliptical trainers, stationary bikes, recumbent bikes, treadmills (all cardio equipment has flat screen TV's with earpieces), dumbells, and a nice selection of stand-alone weight training machines. This facility is much larger than the typical hotel fitness center, with excellent overall layout, reading materials, stretching area, and towels.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, slightly dated, hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Front desk staff were extremely welcoming and friendly, which is not often the case in a larger hotel in our experience. Room was very clean and comfortable, though decor is a little dated. However, at the price we paid on Hotwire we are not seriously complaining! Location is very convenient, adjacent to two major highways. Two excellent shopping malls within a short distance, and the hotel provides free transport to them on request. Free outdoor self-parking nearby or undercover parking at a reasonable charge. Would be perfectly happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Extras Were Costly”
Reviews.Author: Kaitlin22
Reviews.Content: My husband I reserved a room for 4 through an online bidding site. The Westin has a great reputation, so we were excited to "win" this hotel. We were disappointed, however, with only one room option of two double beds. We were also surprised to have to pay for parking (either in the garage or through the valet service). After the extra cost, we spent more than we would have at the Hyatt Place just down the road (also very clean, the room is bigger, and breakfast is included). Though the Westin was nice (and clean), but we will stick with the Hyatt Place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Supervisor - Over the TOP Service!”
Reviews.Author: JordanDMcCormick
Reviews.Content: It was month-end and I had been on the road for nearly a month. As a Sales Professional I needed to submit my expenses by scanning my receipts and submitting them online. I was discouraged when the scanner wasn't operational in the Westin Business Center. Concerned, I approached Sara Means at the Front Desk. She came to my rescue by not only helping me, but scanned my receipt in chronological order on my behalf, sending them to me via email in a timely manner while I was able to relax with my drink of choice at the lobby bar. She and Glen Lacabe them packaged my receipts and thoughtfully placed them under my hotel door. My only bad experience at this hotel was I left my favorite jacket in the Work-Out Room and someone stole it :(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel assistant”
Reviews.Author: toniapurvis
Reviews.Content: Nicole Villano was the best. She made my stay at the Westin Park Central Dallas great. She notified me with my bill and arranged for me to get a room until I could pay. She was very helpful and did all she could to help me enjoy my stay. She truly deserves a raise because she has great customer service skills and I would go back to the hotel just because she's there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Corporate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night during the week, and had a pleasant stay. Our room was of adequate size, and we enjoyed the Westin "heavenly bed". The hotel seemed very busy with training classes, and a large function in the ballroom. It is definitely a large, corporate, business hotel, and not a "get-away" hotel. There is a very large, nice work out room on the third floor, along with a small heated pool surrounded by lounge chairs. There were also two training classes being held at the pool area. I found this odd, and disconcerting wearing wet swimsuits around people in business attire. There is a free parking lot, but we couldn't find it until leaving. We were forced to pay $12 for garage self-parking. I hate this trend in hotels to make paying guests pay to park their cars! The shower had two shower heads, which I have never seen before, and I also liked the leaf shaped soaps, and the Heavenly Spa toiletries in the room. They did smell heavenly. I booked this room through Hotwire for $59 dollars a night under 4 star hotels in Park Central area. I thought this was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: HappyinTheWoodlands
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel several times a year for the last 7 years. It is a great value. The only down side is the cost of parking or a long walk to the free lot.

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: HealthNut80
Reviews.Content: Being the highly prepared business traveler I am, I noticed upon arriving at the hotel that I had forgoten any type of phone charger. Since it was a business conference, I would need to be in contact with many people during that weekend. One of the front desk checked for me in the "stash" of phone chargers that they had. However it was until Younis, one of the front desk representatives offered his personal wall charger that we found a match. Needless to say it made my trip successful and allowed me to not have to run out and spend $40 to buy an extra one that I would no longer use when I got back. These employees definitely go above and beyond what they have to do to make sure that the guests are fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: RickyBobbie
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by my stay at this Westin. They provide amenities and service that business travelers need: quick, polite service, free internet, 24/7 exercise room, ample parking, quiet rooms. The hotel was really crowded when I arrived--it looked like a wedding reception was being held there, but the front desk clerk attended to me right away. There was not a long wait for the elevators even though the hotel is large and crowded. Decore is a little sterile but clean. My room was large, comfortable and quiet. It had modern amenities including a flat screen tv, cordless phone, coffee maker, comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The room was clean. The exercise room was well-equipped and clean too. There is a parking garage but parking is free for members of their frequent traveler program. The price was very reasonable for this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Class Hotel, Isolated Location, Excellent Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Member_Too
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night during a business conference. We were met by a very friendly and helpful Nicole at the front desk. She allowed us to check in early,recommended the Starwood Preferred Guest program which took all of 30 seconds to complete, and upgraded us to the Executive 19th Floor level. Wow. She was AWESOME! The room was fairly standard with some nice touches with the White Linen accents and double headed shower. Two minor drawbacks were the cigarette burn hole in the nice leather office chair and the "mystery" stain on the dust ruffle on one of the double beds. Sound does carry here like other reviews said. I did not notice a vast difference in the Heavenly bed. The hotel services option menu on the TV is not very user friendly,and I had to wander around to find the pool (VERY small!) and fitness center on the Third floor. The fitness center had TV's in the treadmills and complimentary headphones. Weights were limited to dumbells only. The location is fairly isolated from restaurants and is aimed primarily for business travelers and conventions. The Galleria shopping center is about 10-15 minutes away West on 635 at the North Dallas Tollway. Benihana (Japanese flair restaurant) is across the street and a few blocks down. Valet at the hotel was $20 and they were all very nice. One waiter in the Cafe in the Park restaurant for the breakfast buffet seemed disinterested and only stopped by a few times to see if we needed anything. Overall, for a business appointment it is very suitable if you need to be in the area for anything. It is a few blocks away from Hwy 75 North Central Expressway and fronts Hwy 635 LBJ Freeway. Not much going on after business hours unless you have a convention going on there. An interesting note. There is no "13th" floor. 19th is the top room floor, but 20 is listed in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nothing nearby”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a night because the Westin Galleria was not available. Rooms are nice and staff is very attentive but the hotel is in a ghost town of an industrial park. At 3PM in the afternoon no restaurants in the hotel were open, the gift shop was closed, there are no minibars in the room and even the deli in the attached office building was closed. I eventually drove to find fast food for a snack. Kind of a pain. Executive Lounge is big and deserted. Some pretzels were on the tables when I checked in and were still sitting out when I left. No drinks, water or food offered. Continental breakfast offered in the restaurant to Platinums. Baked good looked like Little Debbi cakes. Lobby area is nice if not overwhelmed by the Westin smell that's pumped in. Internet in the hotel was very slow and signal was weak.

Reviews.Title: “As a frequent traveler, I was absolutely...”
Reviews.Author: Jamiebuth
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I was absolutely delighted with the quality of this hotel. The staff was great, good bar and restaurant, and great rooms. I never slept better than in my corner, king room. The only downside is that my future expectations for hotels have risen high.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: oklahomabiologist
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotwire room in Dallas Park Central and this was the 4-star hotel they gave me. Excellent bargain for the hotwire price. I took my boys to watch a Rangers baseball game and we usually stay north of Arlington so not a big deal that we were 45 minutes north of the stadium. If you don't have a car to get around, this would not be the hotel for you. It appeared to be somewhat isolated and not much would be in walking distance. We didn't spend much time at the hotel so I can't comment on the amenities. But, without a doubt, the best hotel bed I have ever slept in!! And I travel quite a bit and the mattresses were very soft and comfortable. Check-in and out was quick and efficient. We had read the reviews and knew that there was a free parking lot across the street and a couple reviewers commented that front desk didn't tell them about it. When we checked in, one of the first things the clerk asked us is if we planned to park at the hotel or in the free lot. So no problems at all there. I do agree with the others that there is no reason to charge to park. The hotel would be better off charging $10 a night higher on the room rate and forego the parking charge as a stand alone charge. Good hotel for our purposes of a one night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away.”
Reviews.Author: jas315
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights here for a mini vacation. Waitstaff was very helpful and friendly. Really laid back for such a nice hotel. No one bothers you unless you want to be bothered. We didn't really experience many of the extra services they had to offer but what we did experience was great. We left the hotel to go somewhere and told the front desk we needed more towels before we got back later that evening. We were gone for 10 minutes and had to come back because we forgot something. In the 10 minutes we were gone, our rooms were cleaned, new towels were, trash was taken, and our bed was made. Great housekeeping service!!! Very calm and soothing atmosphere! Would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service at check-in and check-out”
Reviews.Author: KJP_52
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other travelers who comment that the hotel is isolated and there is a charge for virtually everything on-site. There are many restaurant choices in the area, but you must have a car to get there. I was with a conference, and most of my meals were included. The food is quite good, but I would not have purchased from the restaurants because of the high prices. As a Starwood Gold member, my room was on a Preferred Guest floor. My room was nicely furnished/decorated, modern, spacious and clean. But like other travelers, I could hear my neighbor loud and clear and could even hear conversations in rooms while walking down the hall. Overall, I had a nice stay, but not a WOW stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, service, view and facility.”
Reviews.Author: Brandon19
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Park Central was fantastic. First, I simply asked for a high floor and was upgraded to the Executive Level (top 19th floor). Second, the price was better than any other hotel in the area, including lower ranked hotels (perhaps because the conference negotiated a discount.) Third, I found the facility to be well-maintained and pleasantly appointed. My only negatives are comparitively small inconveniences: The escalator to the Ballroom level was broken, leading to overcrowding on the elevators. The cleaning staff would leave their carts in the middle of the narrow hallways, making it difficult to navigate at times. There was also a knocking sound at 3am - as if someone 2 rooms over were hanging a picture on the wall. (I should have been asleep. If I were it would not have awoken me.)

Reviews.Title: “The Cafe in the Park is fantastic. The service by Angelo & Ken was first class.”
Reviews.Author: Restaurant72
Reviews.Content: The Cafe in the Park was fantastic. The service by Antonio & Ken was first class. Excellent food and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but everything cost extra”
Reviews.Author: Stepana26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend here on a mini-getaway. We booked the hotel with a website advertising 4-star hotels at 2-star prices. So we didn't know we booked this specific hotel until after we paid for it. We got a great price and the hotel was nice. Overall we enjoyed our stay but there are several extra fees. Dogs don't have a nightly fee but there is a $50 deposit. Internet is free in the lobby but has a daily fee in the room. A late check-out also comes with a $50 fee. We had both room service dining and breakfast downstairs in the cafe...both were good but not worth the amount you pay. There is free self parking lot a block away but the hotel staff will not tell you about it. I only learned about it from other reviews. In fact, upon check-in the front desk staff joked around like he was still going to charge for parking even after I stated I was parked in the FREE self-parking lot. Some other observations, the pool is outside. So while it isn't anything fancy, I was able to catch some sun. I think this hotel advertises a whirlpool but I never saw it. The gym is nice and large. The room was nice too and clean. The towels are rough. The hotel isn't located by much other than offices. The only restaurants in walking distance are Benihana (sp?) and Jack N the Box. The Galleria and Valley View Malls are a few exits up IH-635. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the DISCOUNTED price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: MemphisLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: I am so disgusted with this hotel I do not know where to start. First, I traveled the same time the other poster did when the supposed model convention was in town. The hotel was a circus. There were no models, only kids who were loud and extremely obnioxious. I too tried to sit in the lobby to do some research and had to go back to my room after the pounding music gave me a headache. I felt so sorry for the other business travelers who were seated at the table with me. This hotel does not offer free wifi in the rooms, so you have to go to the lobby. This made it impossible. On check in I knew that this hotel was older and they tried really hard to put lipstick on a pig. The lobby is well appointed but old. I got up to my room and it was DISGUSTING. It smelled of mold. The furnishings were dated. The carpet was filthy. Next to the bed on the carpet there were old bobby pins on the floor. The bathroom had mold in the shower. Nothing in the room matched. This hotel is a mess. After two nights of not sleeping I checked out and lost one night here. I could not tolerate the family of 6 in the room next to mine. Yes, six people. I counted them. I tried to complain to the manager but when I was transfered to his office the phone just rang for about 5 minutes. This is a hotel for business travelers. The pool is the size of a hot tub. There is no hot tub. There are no chairs on the patio in which to lay out. The gym is small and stinks. You also have to pay for parking. You will need a car, as there is nothing within walking distance. The hotel is rather secluded. There is a Benihana though. The food is extremely overpriced. I would not recommend eating anywhere in the hotel . Take my advice and do not stay here. There are several hotels that are in the area which offer more amenities for no charge.

Reviews.Title: “All Business”
Reviews.Author: GlobalArizona
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online after searching the properties that I might get (4 stars, N. Dallas, $50 a night), on a name-your-own-price deal. So I knew ahead of time which properties I might get, no surprises. However, after checking in, I discovered that this hotel offers rooms of lower quality to the name-your-own-price bookings. The only reason I know, is that I've stayed at this hotel a few times (for full price) and know there are better standard rooms. At any rate, this is a business hotel, not really suited for the leisure traveler. There are no lounge chairs at the pool, they offer a complimentary cocktail and snack on weeknights for business travelers, they don't on weekends. The housekeepers knocked on my door twice to ask when I was leaving, tacky the 2nd time... Everything is extra, parking, internet... For a Westin, supposedly 4 stars, I'd barely rate them with 3 stars. I stay at Starwood properties (including Westin) often, and found this property to be the worst. Un less you're on business, and can expense everything out.

Reviews.Title: “First two nights..eh. Second two nights...awful.”
Reviews.Author: bridget1007
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood member and I have been for years. I have always received top notch customer service at every Starwood hotel until the Dallas Park Central. I was in Dallas on business. We checked in on June 20th. The woman who checked in was brilliant. She offered to put us up on a higher floor which was a nice touch. The lobby is nicely decorated and updated. When we got into the room that is where it stopped. The bathroom was dirty with a huge glob of womens makeup on the wall behind the door. Also the blanket was stained with makeup. The room was obviously old. Now, let me interject this was a last minute business trip and I did use priceline to save money, but I do not believe any paying customer should ever have to put up with what went on at this hotel. On the second day there was a huge "model" expo. The hotel literally turned into a night club. There were kids screaming up and down the hall all night long. It was impossible to get an elevator. Remember folks, this hotel still charges 9.95 for wifi, when all other 4 star hotels include this. You can get free internet in the lobby, but there was pounding music and "models" everywhere. It was literally a zoo. I have never in my life been in a hotel and had to deal with this. Being down in Dallas for an interview this was unacceptable. When I complained to the manager he half listened and told me that they host this "model" expo twice a year. To me it sounded like. " We are making a huge amount of money on this and I could care less about your concerns." My advice, before you make a reservation make sure there is no "model" expo. Also, I rode up on the elevator with a man who had checked in at that time. He was not notified there was a nightclub in the hotel. So none of the guests were provided with a warning! The manager did give me a voucher for two free nights, but frankly I would never stay here again. It is an old hotel and that is evident in every corner. Oh, and don't forget to use the free parking that is a block away. Otherwise you will pay a load of money on parking. I have no idea why they charge for parking, since it is in an isolated area. Overall, it really is not worth the money. Unless you get a great rate like I did, and there is no "model" expo going on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KClibrarian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights in early June. All of the hotel personnel I encountered were friendly and helpful in answering my questions and went out of their way to help solve a transportation problem. The lobby was decorated in an attractive, contemporary, minimalist style. My room was quiet and clean. Although the bed was too soft and left me with a sore back the next morning, there were a half dozen pillows that could be used as "body pillows" and that solved the problem for the remaining nights. The room contained three packets of Starbucks coffee (one of them decaf), some tea bags, and a one-cup coffee maker that was very handy. The surrounding area is not particularly interesting from a tourist standpoint (office buildings, highways), but if you'd like to get out of the hotel for some exercise, ask for a trail map at the front desk. There are three- and five-mile hikes you can take, if you can stand the heat in summer. I walked about four miles on a fairly attractive, well-traveled paved trail that started in a park two blocks away; it winds through various fields and parks, though also across highway exit ramps. The only caveat is that if you are attending a conference and have celiac disease and need gluten-free meals you may have difficulty obtaining them. The banquet staff (which may or may not be different than the regular restaurant staff) did not seem to grasp what gluten-free meant and repeatedly served me meals containing gluten, although they were given advance notice of dietary restrictions for all attendees and I provided the server at every meal with a note briefly listing what foods/ingredients were off-limits. I haven't had this much problem with meals at any conference I've attended. On the plus side, the servers were very attentive and friendly, and food service was extremely attentive, quick, and efficient -- the best service I've experienced at any conference I've attended. I would have greatly appreciated free wifi, but this seems to be a rarity in hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, quiet room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: benjudy
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and our four-month old baby for a Friday night getaway at this hotel 25 minutes from home by car. Lacking the time or money for a traveling vacation, we used airline miles to stay here for free. We just needed an overnight mini-vacation "away from it all" and our stay at this hotel was perfect for that. We had peace & quiet, time alone together, away from the busyness of life and just a short drive from home. As other reviewers have commented, the closest free parking is a block away. This was not terribly inconvenient for us. I simply loaded & unloaded at the hotel entrance and walked the short distance. Hotel employees helped us with our luggage. If we were staying longer than one night this walking back and forth to avoid paying for parking might have begun to feel like a burden. Also, in the hot Texas summer months it would have been more uncomfortable. As it was, I didn't mind. The street I had to walk across was not busy. The parking lot did not appear to have any security, but the neighborhood was one where I felt comfortable parking overnight. Pros: Every hotel staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful. The room was acceptably clean, and we are somewhat picky about cleanliness. The heavenly bed and shower were a big plus. We all slept very soundly. Our room was quiet with minimal noise only from people in the hall going in an out of adjoining rooms. Our view from the 12th floor was as nice as you're going to get along I-635 in north Dallas. Cons: no free Internet, $10 per day to use wifi. This is our biggest complaint, and something the hotel could change for the benefit of guests. Many hotels now offer complimentary Internet connections. All of our other gripes are minor: No vent in the bathroom; taking hot showers made the bathroom and bedroom humid (A/C worked well, however.) No complimentary breakfast -- the menu in the room seemed high-priced and uninteresting to us, so I drove out & picked up something to eat. (Again, we didn't have a lot of money to fund this overnight getaway, so perhaps breakfast at the hotel would be reasonable for many guests.) For some weird reason, the Weather Channel seemed to be giving us local info for Pennsylvania rather than north Texas. But we were able to get local weather info from the local DFW news stations. There is a phone hung on the wall directly next to the toilet. I nearly knocked it off the wall and into the towlet bowl. The cord was long enough to allow it to fall in there. I recommend either relocating the phone or using a shorter cord to prevent the handset from falling into the toilet. (Personally, I would never use that phone anyway -- how sanitary can a hotel phone be if it's right next to a toilet? Think about it...) All in all, for this to be ranked a four-star hotel I would call it simply average at that. No major gripes, but nothing that especially impressed us beyond the comfortable bed and cleanliness, which one would expect at a highly-rated hotel. Seeing that the room would have cost us only about $114 after taxes, I think it's a good place to stay. We didn't use the other amenities which include an outdoor pool and a small gym. For us to spend the night free, it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We are here now”
Reviews.Author: ebladygolfer
Reviews.Content: We have come to Dallas to see a friend in the hospital which is nearby. I agree with some of the comments about it is not quite westin quality. The towels are very bad quality....not the plush ones that we have experienced many times in other Westins. But was superb as usual but I agree with another post about the cons...having to pay for internet access especially on the weekends makes me not want to ever come back here again. But location is great for this visit and bed was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfotable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Jason
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick one night trip on a business trip. The valet was very friendly, pointing out the phone number to call to have car retrieved. Check in was quick, and for some reason, I got a coupon for a free breakfast (waybe due to my Starwood status?). The lobby of the hotel was very nice, very airy and obviously fairly new.
